intro: Citharexylum rosei var. durangensis, commonly known as the Durango rosewood, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine. Its wood is also prized for its rich scent and durability in carpentry.
